website_summaries.verdict: A well-built machine that can make soy milk in about 15 minutes in its stainless steel boiling chamber.
pros: Tribest's Soy Milk Maker makes safety a priority with its concealed heating element, but with its temperature-control cycle, you are assured great soy milk with every batch
Additionally, the included accessories allow you to convert the machine into a coffee grinder
cons: For optimum functionality, you will need to keep up with cleaning, which may be more time consuming than is desirable

customer_reviews.title: Great for making nut milks!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, simple to clean, and makes a full pot of milk with just one cup of nuts or seeds. I've used it to make almond, cashew, and pumpkin seed milk and all turned out great. No additional straining necessary.
customer_reviews.author: TraceInvader

customer_reviews.title: Soyabella your awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this appliance! It is easy to use and simple to clean. The almond milk taste amazing. It's just almonds and pure water and no chemicals. All I can say is buy this, you will be so happy!! There is also a coffee grinder function and you can make other nut milks and rice milk as well. I have been extremely happy with my soyabella.
customer_reviews.author: Kellian H

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So EASY to make soy milk and almond milk. I used to use my Vitamix - but this is much simpler since I don't have to first soak beans, cook them and then grind and put through nut bag. 15 minutes - and done!
customer_reviews.author: N. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: No Additives!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this since January, I got it because of whar is in any of the commercial nut milks nowadays. Very little nuts! This thing takes soaked nuts and filtered water and produces the most delicious milks. I use it in smoothies, on cereal/oatmeal and drink it alone. I don’t add vanilla or sugar-it is great by itself, I highly recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: SarahA

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and makes delicious almond milk!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to make our own almond milk and it's the best milk we've ever had! Can highly recommend. If there was any negative at all, it's just that I wish it could make larger amounts at a time, we go through it so quickly! Easy to use, clean-up is simple, quick and painless and the milk is delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Abby Baker

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Love Enough!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and clean. I use this to make almond milk and the product is thick and frothy. I'm still trying to find a recipe so that it tastes more like Almond Breeze, right now I'm just drinking it plain. I've used the milk for soup, cereal, coffee, hot cocoa, etc. Living in the middle of nowhere, I can't just run out and get almond milk, so this is a faster, cheaper alternative for me.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa Larson

customer_reviews.title: I love soy milk and this soymilk maker is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love soy milk and this soymilk maker is amazing. I get the organic soy beans from Whole Foods and my delicious milk is ready in 30 mins. I prefer to make my own soymilk instead of store bought because I know exactly what it is that I am drinking. No chemicals or preservatives. I tried making almond milk with this maker once because the instructions said it can. It didn't turn out too well. I may have to re-read the instructions. Soy milk works just fine. I bought this maker for soymilk so I am not disappointed that my one attempt at almond milk failed. I would have bought this earlier if I had known this existed!!
customer_reviews.author: Paramus mom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it worked great. I went to use it again and it would not work. I contacted the company and they replied that a service rep would contact me but I not heard anything so I am sending the unit back to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: I used it ONE time, run smoothly and great, almost no sound, great milk. BUT when I was about to pour the milk into a jar, the little screws on top (that make the whole machine work - I guess they are a part of a security system) came OUT and got lost! They are TINY and have tiny little springs that, of course, came flying out and got lost too. Well, no milk for me, and no machine either. Went back to where it belongs. Terrible thing, they should test their machines and parts before shipping! I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jimena diaz

customer_reviews.title: No power cord // Box was in poor condition
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with a power cord and the box was in poor condition. Very disappointed and surprised this made it through quality control...
customer_reviews.author: Sean Dolan

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this unit! I use it at least once per week to make plant based milk and other drinks. I use the pulp to make muffins or granola, etc.
customer_reviews.author: MWalker

customer_reviews.title: The engine slowed after about 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I loved it at first until the engine slowed and the nut/seed cup started leaving behind a lot more unground seeds. I was making primarily hempmilk. I sent the machine in for repair under the warranty and eventually got it back with a new power cord, but no improvement to the reduced engine power. I stopped using it. My old blender now does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: S McGrath

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: This machine is worth the expense if you plan to make soy milk regularly. It just makes it so much easier. Whether the machine itself is better than other ones out there--I'm not sure. This one works well, not the cheapest, not the priciest. I'm happy with it and use it several times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: The invincible soymilk machine
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this soymilk maker, it took two days to use it. Once I used it, I realized that it was invincible and difficult to use, invincible was difficult to clean, and it was easy to leak water and electricity. After the soymilk was squeezed and the soymilk bottle was very hot, it would be easy to burn I really regret buying it, I can only return it,
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: This item is the best! With this machine I cut my soymilk and ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is the best! With this machine I cut my soymilk and soy cheese making by more than half. Extremely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Megan L

customer_reviews.title: Works well, is fast and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and grinds the beans well resulting in about 6 cups of nice white soy milk. I spent some time until I found the Soyabella which grinds the beans and contains the fiber in the blending cup. One just has to remember not to submerge either the top or the pitcher/base in water. I just pour my soapy water into the pitcher wash it clean, rinse out the soap suds, dry it and I am done. Fast and easy and inexpenisve way to get homemade soy milk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a gift and my friend absolutely ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift and my friend absolutely loves it! She has been making her own almond milk for a long time. She said that it makes milk so quickly that she can make it in the morning before she goes to work.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Rees

customer_reviews.title: Fast but flavor isn’t as good.
customer_reviews.text: The nut cup is Very hard to put on and take off. I don’t think the flavor is as good as when I make it in the blender and strainer. It is certainly easier to use than the blender.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Doe

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1 month after purchase
customer_reviews.text: At the first time i used it, it was just perfet! Loved it! The second time it just didn't work, It is not turning on! I'm will contact Tribella in order to ask to be replaced...
customer_reviews.author: TATISE A.

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Great product simple to use and clean. Have to clean immediately so the mesh doesn’t get clogged up. I just wish it came in a larger container to make more than it currently does. The mesh does filter out most of the gunk but there is always some left no matter the brands.
customer_reviews.author: Halcyon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome soymilk machine !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg I love this machine! Easy to use , clean and fun! First batch of almond milk sooo yummy. Cant wait to add more ingredients for even tastier milks.
customer_reviews.author: Anye

customer_reviews.title: Exceed my expectations
customer_reviews.text: That was my first time using the Soyabella to make soy milk. It was easy and the milk was ready fast. It usually take me longer to make milk. The machine make it easy, the milk taste so good.
customer_reviews.author: Yanique

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Good Finished Product.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and very clear instructions. If I had previously known that a a soy milk machine like this existed, I would have purchased it. While cleanup could still be easier, the finished product tastes like the fresh-made Chinese soy milks in Asia. If you add a bit of sugar and vanilla, it also tastes like the western soy milks. I have made more than 12 batches of soy milk and two of almond milk... and the left-over, high-fibre okara makes great omelets and can be used as a meat substitute. The soy milk can also be turned into "flower tofu" by adding a coagulant and some ginger syrup. It has been both a fun and educational purchase.
customer_reviews.author: OhioAwesome

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have made many batches of soy milk with this machine and perfect results every time.
customer_reviews.author: caroline

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this for almond and cashew milk, so I can't speak to its soymilk making abilities. But for my purposes, it's great -- easy to use and makes milk far more delicious than anything store-bought.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: So quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Pros - delicious milk in minutes, easy to use, doesn’t take up too much space, pretty easy to clean Cons - instructions aren’t great (YouTube is great though), difficult to twist the grinder basket on/off and messy when taking it off and very few Soyabella recipes (Almond Cow www is better)
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana H. Anglin

customer_reviews.title: not worthy
customer_reviews.text: although the machine did work the milk produced did not
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: soymilk setting doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Really like how this machine looks and functions, except it doesn't make soymilk. The other settings work great, the machine is easy to clean, the instructions are clear, etc. But the setting to make soymilk just produces a warning beep. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greathouse

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t grid up nuts well enough to extract maximum flavor and nutrients. Prefer vitamix and a nut bag
customer_reviews.author: Carly Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Milk option doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The milk option doesn't work. The instruction manual is pour and not clear. Second time I received a machine that doesn't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Tanush

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases for the money I’ve spent.
customer_reviews.author: Sara J. Snow

customer_reviews.title: Takes some tries to get to the desired consistency
customer_reviews.text: I’m still trying to figure out how many times I have to press the Mill button in order to get all the almonds to go break. I’m already up to five times but there are still many almonds that do not break down. Also the blade loosens up each time, and has at one time come off inside the milk screen with the pulp. Other than this..I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very powerful at grinding up coffee beans or making nut milk. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite toys
customer_reviews.text: I no longer drink regular milk so and don't have the patience to make my almond milk in my vitamix, so i bought a soyabella. I love this machine! next to my juicer and vitamix, this is one of my favorite toys. i make milk in 10 minutes and no need for a cheese cloth or squeezing. so easy to clean too. love drinking home made almond milk.
customer_reviews.author: libthechie

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My family likes this machine. It is easy to operate, easy to clean, and any nuts can be made. Cheap and good quality.We use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: F. Yuan

customer_reviews.title: Makes good Almond Milk and grinds coffee beans better than my coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love it Need a replacement Grinder Cup Please let me know how much will cost
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Laing

customer_reviews.title: Good but defected after one month
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product at the beginning. However, machine seems to be louder than day one. Light wasn't on couple of times, had to unplug it. Returned. Buying another one. Hope there's no defect.
customer_reviews.author: Chau Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: but I actually really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I use this appliance a lot more than I thought I would. I make raw nut milks, soy milk, corn cream soup, and prep pecan milk for a yogurt drink using the Soybella. It turns several steps into one. It has a screen that works well and a plastic cup you can use for soaking the screen in case you can't get to washing it right away. The possibilities are endless with this item! I was unsure of the in-system straining process at first, but I actually really like it.
customer_reviews.author: senna zee

customer_reviews.title: so easy!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to make soymilk with my blender - it was a mess to clean up, the milk was full of sediment and it took about 5 times as long. I LOVE this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: It's not difficult to make almond milk! It's a very good product I can say!
customer_reviews.author: Amazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around machine
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use and cleaning. Makes easy and great but milks in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Donna R

customer_reviews.title: Soybella - super easy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Soybella soy milk maker about a month ago. I have found it super easy to use and the final product is wonderful (especially the first warm cup). I strain through cheesecloth and add a little vanilla or stevia if I want something sweet. As far as the noise of the grinding, it is GRINDING...not a shock that it might make some noise. In short, worth every penny. We use a lot of soymilk, so each time I make a pitcher I set some more beans to soak in the fridge. Many uses for the okara or you can just throw it in the compost. I would highly recommend this product. Very little work with great results.
customer_reviews.author: JKG

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Highly recommend. Customer service team is friendly and responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Dawg LB

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it!! Easy to use! The secreta is to pack the almonds one day before to use it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far
customer_reviews.text: Use it 3 times per week for nut milk. Love it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Maria M.

customer_reviews.title: Milk quality isn’t up to par
customer_reviews.text: There’s always pulp in the milk... it makes it impossible to get a smooth milk...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase this soymaker!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this item as the 1st one that I bought from another retailer stopped working just after using it for a few times. And I purchased another and hoped that my bad luck was gone. However, both the bottoms of the two filters/containers fell out after 4 months. I tried to reach out to the manufacturer's customer service to see if they can be replaced, I don't get any response from them. Poor quality and bad service! :(
customer_reviews.author: Dehong Kong

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to use and to clean and makes the most ...
customer_reviews.text: It's very easy to use and to clean and makes the most delicious milk !! Thank you. Just what I was looking for !!
customer_reviews.author: Lois A. Bogee

customer_reviews.title: How long I have to replace another one ?
customer_reviews.text: I like it very much. I only use it to make soy milk for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Easy to make almond milk
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to make almond milk... makes it in minutes! I paid for fast shipping and it arrived 4 days later then expected. It might be quicker buying through the actual company.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent economical and easy almond milk
customer_reviews.text: Excellent economical and easy almond milk, other nut or seed milks, and great crackers from the pulp. So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Vegetarian for Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Its useful...
customer_reviews.text: Now my diet is changing.....I m eating nature food..it s important to me prepare soy milk......because the cow milk is dangeorus......The soyabellasoy milk is great..thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought soya bella milk maker. It is a great product. A friend of mine recommended to me. It is easy to use. The milk is so delicious and healthy. Without of the chemicals and preserves. I recommend this products.
customer_reviews.author: Vero's reviews

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after 3 times of making soy milk
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy to receive it. It stopped working during the first week. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This worked exactly as the maker indicated it would. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to drink healthy milk. I made almond milk per the recipe in the booklet and loved it.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Makes excellent soymilk everytime. Saves money and is easy to use and clean. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys soymilk.
customer_reviews.author: Nick W

customer_reviews.title: Soyabella Soymilk Maker (SB-130)
customer_reviews.text: I like this machine , because of the sleek look and the heating element is not exposed to the milk. I recommed it go for it.
customer_reviews.author: SEYED

customer_reviews.title: Broke in the first week of using it, can't ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke in the first week of using it, can't return as I don't have the packaging since moving house :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this model because of the voltage. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model because of the voltage. It was ment to be 220v. But it's 110v. I'm from Argentina and I can't use it here.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super easy fresh soy milk!
customer_reviews.text: I use this baby every other day, and it is fantastic! Everyone I tell about it wants one and they even offer to buy my soy milk!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Shumar

customer_reviews.title: DIY Fresh Soymilk Is a PITA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soymilk maker because I really really like the unsweetened soymilk I buy at the grocery store. I thought I'd like fresh soy milk even better. I do not. Also, the unit hard to clean, there is a TON of ground soybean waste to throw away, and it's just a huge hassle, really.
customer_reviews.author: CRL

customer_reviews.title: I have been searching for this one like forever, now I have been used it for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for this one like forever, now I have been used it for so long and every week! I LOVE this item. One of the best soy machine out there! Please, if you like soymilk like me... this is where you need purchase and you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Plum Chen

customer_reviews.title: Why all the hype?
customer_reviews.text: I've been using one for over a month now and I am still trying to understand what all the raving and ranting is all about. Mine sounds like a lawn mower when grinding and the beeps are super annoying when it's done. The cleaning is the most cumbersome for me since it has to be hand-washed after each use. And the milk tastes nothing like the store-bought kind.
customer_reviews.author: Viva!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, haven't tried it yet but I'm sure it will be a great help.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The item sent to me did not meet the power condition in Singapore, which is 220V. I was very shocked to learn that this was handled very unprofessionally. SH Chan
customer_reviews.author: Dr Chan Siew Hwa

customer_reviews.title: Just-WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with the Soyabella...it works amazingly...and the combinations are endless. I'm used to using my VitaMix & nut milk bag-to make all my nut milks, which works great-but to use the Soyabella is life changing. The mill cycle does a great job with the raw nut milks (just play with the nut to water ratios...etc., to suit your taste). The heated 'milk' cycle is a bonus...I experimented and made a cashew/soy milk and it was amazing. I can't say enough about this machine including the price-buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best products that I have purchased in a very long time! It makes perfect soy milk every time....and it's simple. I've been using non dairy milks for many, many years but always purchased them. These days I find it difficult to find alternatives that don't have added sugars etc or they aren't made from organic, non GMO beans. Now I can have soy and other alternative milks with only things that I choose to add......and much cheaper! I am so pleased with the product that now I'm even trying my hand at making tofu from the soy milk that I make. First batch was a winner! I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie & Kates Mom

customer_reviews.title: Having an Internal Filter is a BIG advantage
customer_reviews.text: I used to believe that simply running your nut and grain milk through a cheesecloth is no big deal. In fact using an outside filter of any kind should be the same, but to be honest having this done internally seems to work A LOT better. It makes it easier to clean, seems to propel the main product OUT of the filter leaving less not more product in the filter zone. I like the idea that it has both a heating and a cold grind capability and that it literally could be used like a coffee pot for roasted beans (although that might affect the flavor of anything else you put in it).
customer_reviews.author: Han Solo

customer_reviews.title: it's fine to use
customer_reviews.text: it's fine to use, but cleaning for soy milk production is a task, always. and if I don't screw the nut butter in tight, it gets loose, and scratched, and damaged. by the way, do u have the nut clear cup that hold the nuts while spining? it had been damaged by the blades. I may need replacement part. thank you. I haven't looked around. If u have, pls let me know.
customer_reviews.author: ROSE XXX

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as squeezing my own milk
customer_reviews.text: I got this in hopes that I could make almond milk making less messy and stop using my nut bag. Unfortunately, it fell completely short. First, it doesn't hold enough almonds to make my usual batch, so the milk tends to be more watered down. Second, it doesn't strain very well and leaves behind a lot of pulp, so I wind up having to use my nut bag anyways. I'm really bummed to have spent the money on this machine for it to not do the job I had hoped it would it would. The reviews seemed to lean towards being a great option for nut milks but I don't think it is at all.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smithee

customer_reviews.title: Works very well for making soy milk, other milks, and soups
customer_reviews.text: This is a good device for making soy milk and other milks such as almond milk, and it can also make porridges and soups. For soy milk it does the necessary step of heating up the beans before it grinds them, and its heating capacity works great with soups. Even if you don’t always drink soy milk it is good to use this for making homemade tofu from soybeans, for example.
customer_reviews.author: emu_amazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice but why is it squeaking already?
customer_reviews.text: This makes excellent soy milk! But I find that the instructions are off. You only need about 1/4 cup of soybeans to make a decent milk. My only grip is that I have only had it about 2 months and used it about 4 times and it's already squeaking. It still works but I fear it make go out. I give it four starts for now because it hasn't yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tigress

customer_reviews.title: Frugal Vegan Investment Appliance
customer_reviews.text: So freakin’ easy! I’m already recouping my investment bc soybeans are so inexpensive compared to prepared mylks. Pecan is more expensive, but a nice treat :) Easy to clean machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Hemmingsen

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. No mess
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. No mess, easy to clean. For almond milk I recommend feel water below the line. Also great for flavoring water with fruits.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean. Makes a great milk. It is a little tricky to put the cup of nuts onto the top. You have to jiggle as the blade descends into the nuts. I also use a strainer bag to get half a cup more milk from finished pulp. You will need to push the mill button 9 times not 5 as recommended to get all nuts crushed but it responds quickly. I would Recomend it if you use nut milk each day.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Not so efficient milling, too many parts, difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it heats up, and that you can make a milk without straining. But it is so impossible to clean, and there is zero flexibility when it comes to temperature, timing, or grinding. I am not using it anymore, I wnet back to my good old Oysterizer.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Ebtinger

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I love the Soybella for making almond milk.. It is SO EASY to use. Previously I used my Nutribullet Rx, which works well for processing almond milk, but I had to also squeeze the milk through a nut bag by hand to separate out the pulp. The Soybella eliminates this step and collects the pulp in a container and you can easily make the pulp into almond flour.
customer_reviews.author: Estelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for raw milks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this last night and got it this morning. I had already soaked my almonds overnight so quickly unpacked and washed everything and made almond milk. WOW! I think from start to clean up it took me less than 5 minutes and I had yummy, fresh, smooth milk. So happy! Soaking flax seeds now. I must tell you I had been making almond milk using my Blendtec blender and straining through a strainer and then a nut milk bag- TIME CONSUMING!!! This Soybella grinds finer and thus gets more milk from less almonds- Savings there too!
customer_reviews.author: T. Steiner

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work so good to make almon milk
customer_reviews.text: To make almon milk , this doesn’t work. .It is very difficult and you need so mucho almonds to make a liter of milk , the only good thing is the filter , the rest we can do with a blender
customer_reviews.author: caridad Hidalgo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: You can do a lot of things with this from boiling water to making oakmeal, also oakmeal milk, nut milk ,even peanut milk yummy
customer_reviews.author: hendo

customer_reviews.title: very good product
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product. Not that easy to clean though because you have to be careful of electric contacts
customer_reviews.author: H. Weigandt

customer_reviews.title: Love the Soyabella
customer_reviews.text: Love the Soyabella. Makes almond milk much easier than the soymilk maker I had before. It makes cold almond milk in less than a minute. No straining, unless I want an extra straining.(I don't) Easy cleanup. The almond meal stays in the cup and easy to remove and save for other things. Makes heated almond milk too, but why when cold is so easy and it tastes really good.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: 5+ stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the recommendation of raw foodist Mimi Kirk. I am in love with it! It’s so easy to use, super fast and makes superb nut milk. I made cashew milk last night and added some to my tea this morning.
customer_reviews.author: sfdesiree

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic milks
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the manufacturer was thinking with only having the motor run for 10 seconds at a time and needing to run five cycles or more to make the milk, but the end-product is absolutely fantastic. Clean up isn’t that big a deal either. Very happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: bigj5e

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend using around youngsters that want to help you in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Challenging to clean but worth it. Directions could use some tweaking. I got more out of watching YouTube. But I glad I purchased it, I only wish I had gotten the yogurt maker option. I’ve only used the soy milk portion so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle  Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and cleans up fast. It would be nice if there was more information on making different kinds of milk and adjustments to attain certain flavors and needs
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: To complicated for me
customer_reviews.text: It works good. My only complaint is that it’s so complicated to put the almonds and the insert to Have them mix. And it’s a lot to clean. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 5 weeks distributer drags on warranty
customer_reviews.text: It was good when it was working. After five weeks, the blade stopped spinning. The company tribest has no intention of honoring the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great for 7 months, then it died.
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the Soyabella for making soy and nut milks every week since March. It worked well until today. 7 months. What a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Jak of many trades

customer_reviews.title: I found this versatile machine very easy to operate with a full cup of either dry ...
customer_reviews.text: The primary reason for me to buy Soyabella is the okara filter feature that many soymilk makers don't build it anymore. That makes the soymilk more smooth and okara can also be used for many delicious ways. After weeks of uses, I found this versatile machine very easy to operate with a full cup of either dry or soaked soy beans that I can't really tell the taste difference. Cleaning is quite easy as long as right after each use. For me, I just make one time of two full cups / bottles (2.6L) of soymilk, store them in the refrigerator, and that makes a happy lazy bachelor for a week!
customer_reviews.author: song

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have made soy, cashew znd almond milk with very little mess! Great accessory to my kitchen@
customer_reviews.author: PJ Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great nut milk
customer_reviews.text: Have used since 10/2016 to make nut milks. Very easy. I do mill extra for a fine grind and also strain for extra smooth nut milk.I like this better than The Almond Cow that I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: DEBL.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! Easy to use and super easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A Dertian

customer_reviews.title: Works great for almond milk!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, and speeds up the work flow when it comes to making almond milk. Still have yet to try making soy in it but overall it was a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of making nut milk! Love it so much I bought another one for my daughter in law!
customer_reviews.author: Judy Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This has been extremely useful for us and has saved us so much money
customer_reviews.text: We have a dairy allergy at home, so buying the rice milk became expensive. This has been extremely useful for us and has saved us so much money. It makes milk quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia

customer_reviews.title: this is the best machine I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: this is the best machine I have ever bought . Now I can do my own organic milk (almond, soybean ,hazelnut). It works perfectly .
customer_reviews.author: yn n

customer_reviews.title: So happy with the Soyabella
customer_reviews.text: This item is really incredible. You get amazing milk, and can make delicious soups....So easy to operate and clean. I am very satisfied with this Soy milk maker. You can buy it you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Emma S.

customer_reviews.title: wonderful tasting nut milks!
customer_reviews.text: really love this item! I use it to make cashew & almond milk at least a couple times a week (see youtube for instructions and how-to's) the taste is amazing and I know every ingredient that goes into our milks (very important as they are putting more and more into store bought milks these days!) plus, the cost effectiveness and availability of having milk on hand easily outweighs the one time output on the price of the unit. Great value and a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy~

customer_reviews.title: Glad we bought it
customer_reviews.text: We really like it. By watching for the almonds to be on sale we feel it saves us money. I do wish it held a bit more, but it doesn't take too long to make more, so it's okay. Our reason for purchasing it is that It was recommended to us.
customer_reviews.author: Charles B Walker

product_meta.title: Tribest Soyabella SB-130 Soymilk and Nut Milk Maker, Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: The Tribest Soyabella is the elegantly easy way to make fresh soymilk, vegan milks, and hot soups at home! With Soyabella, you can make fresh milk from beans, rice, nuts and seeds in your own kitchen. Soyabella makes delicious nut and seed milks in less than 1 minute and removes the work of straining. Soyabella also makes soymilk, rice milk, and milk from other beans in as little as 15 minutes. Soyabella is also great for making delicious pureed soups and porridges like split pea soup, butternut squash soup, and rice porridge. Soyabella can even grind coffee beans and other dry ingredients with its convenient milling accessories. Soyabella is extremely convenient with different program settings that let you easily control temperature and grinding time with a single touch. Soyabella's multiple attachments allow you to create a cornucopia of recipes without difficult cleaning. Unlike other soymilk makers, Soyabella does not have an exposed heating coil, but instead features a safely hidden heating element inside its stainless steel boiling chamber - offering easier cleanup and added safety. Soyabella's advanced safety features also prevent overflows, dry heating, and overheating for safe and reliable operation. Soyabella is the sleek and elegant alternative milk maker that is as pleasing to the eye as it is to the body.
feature_bullets: Makes soymilk, nut milks, porridge, rice paste, and much more in just 15 minutes
Makes raw almond milk, cashew milk, and other raw nut milks in as little as 30 seconds
Easily converts into a coffee grinder with the included accessories
Concealed heating element for safe operation and easy cleaning
Temperature-controlled cycle yields perfect results every time

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
